If you want the VPN-connected clients to have _all_ IP traffic redirected through your internet gateway -- that is, any IP address that your server resolves will be resolved in exactly the same way by the clients, and your VPN server basically becomes a NAT -- then use redirect-gateway, along with iptables

If you use redirect-gateway and the proper firewall rules, then you can determine which routes your VPN clients can access by sitting down at the server's console and pinging sites... whatever responds will also be accessible to clients
